claims.object: Duty cycle of the main switch Q1

surface_layer.definition: A Single-Ended Primary-Inductor Converter (SEPIC) is a type of DC-DC converter that allows the output voltage to be greater than, less than, or equal to the input voltage.

deep_layer.mechanism: SEPIC converters exchange energy between inductors and capacitors to convert from one voltage to another voltage.
deep_layer.origin: Developed to provide a versatile DC-DC conversion solution.

visual_features: Contains inductors, capacitors, and a switching element
